    • Constructor Detail

      • GameOfLifeBoard

        public GameOfLifeBoard(java.lang.String initialBoard,
                       int height,
                       int width)
        Initializes game board to a preset game board that is stored as a single line string, and has a specified width and height.
        Parameters:
        initialBoard - String representing the map as a single line.
        height - The width of the game board in tiles.
        width - The height of the game board in tiles.

      • GameOfLifeBoard

        public GameOfLifeBoard(char[][] initialBoard,
                       int height,
                       int width)
        Initializes game board to a preset game board that is stored as a 2D char array and has a specified width and height.
        Parameters:
        initialBoard - 2D char array representing the game board. The first entry in initialBoard represents the top left of the game board and the last entry in initialBoard represents the bottom right of the char array.
        height - The width of the game board in tiles.
        width - The height of the game board in tiles.

    • Method Detail

      • oneTurn

        public void oneTurn()
        Progresses the game one turn using the current state of the game board.

        The rules for progression are based on John Conway's 'Game of Life' a rule-set for generating cellular automaton. If a cell is alive and has more than 3 neighbors it dies to over crowding. If a cell is alive and has less than 2 neighbors it dies to starvation. If a cell is dead and has exactly 3 living neighbors it becomes alive.

        The new state is saved to the global variable (gameBoard) while the old state is copied from the original (gameBoard) to (gameBoardLastTurn)

      • steadyState

        public boolean steadyState()
        Checks to see if board didn't change after a turn.

        If a board stays the same after one turn, it will continue to stay the same for any number of turns. The board is said to be a steady state.

        Returns:
        boolean true if the board did NOT change.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Prints the game board as a 2D char array where '.' are dead cells
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String formatted from the gameBoard to printout 2D gameBoard
